data.title: add RemoveSmudge function
data.body:
Allow not only Add smudges in SmudgeLayer but remove them too. This need to clean craters then put new concrete on rocks with craters or on concrete with craters.

Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4791.

data.title: SpatiallyPartitioned fixup for d2
data.body: Sprites can have negative height and width. But this function generate exception for such sprites.

data.title: Refactored Missile.RangeLimit to be a WDist value
data.body:
Tick-based `RangeLimit` is tedious to get right (you need to divide weapon Range by projectile speed, and that doesn't even cover any kind of acceleration), and many values throughout the shipping mods + TS are rough or even arbitrary guesses.

This refactor gives much more accurate control over maximum flight distance, especially in mods like TS which use acceleration.

All yaml updates were done automatically via the provided upgrade rules.

data.title: [NEEDS CONFERMATION] Anti-Air can see cloaked phase tank.
data.body: My phase tank drove near an AA gun and suddenly everything attacked it. Is this the intended behavior?

data.title: Map upgrading is broken with FileNotFoundException

> File `*path*\*mapname*.oramap.451.tmp` not found 

And something about `WinIOError`. Can't post the full exception because the utility doesn't write it to any log.

Win7x64.

data.title: Halven CloseEnough on Stinger.
data.body:
With 170 Speed, 298 CloseEnough, and 128 Spread, it will always act as a proximity weapon against the targets. Other missiles aren't affected because all the other missiles have a fair margin to satisfy the optimal Speed+Spread > CloseEnough condition.

(With this change, there is a ~26% chance (1-(128/149)²) to deliver 37% damage and all the other cases full damage due to the missile characteristics and since the Speed is 170, a unit must move at 128 speed to outrun the missile and trigger it turning back to hit it).

Fixes #10186.

data.body:
In my last game, a destroyer of the AI was firing at my building, but there was no damage. 
Appears in playtest-20160424, no problems in release-20151224.
Bug?

data.title: Fix ProvidesPrerequisite not refreshing the tech tree (on owner change)
data.body:
Not sure if this is the correct approach. Context (see also https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/pull/191):

> 21:44:08 (abcdefg30) ok, so I might need some advice here
> 21:44:22 (abcdefg30) it works how I want it too, but not sure if that's the right thing to do
> 21:44:38 (abcdefg30) case: we have a neutral airport, when you capture it you get faction specific paradrops
> 21:45:03 (abcdefg30) unfortunately, we need different prerequisites for the different faction specific paradrops
> 21:45:15 (abcdefg30) so I just let the building itself provide a faction specific prereq
> 21:45:42 (abcdefg30) now the thing: the building just grants the prereq of the first owner (which would be neutral with its faction)
> 21:46:17 (abcdefg30) when I capture the neutral building then, I still somehow get the old factions prereq / paratroopers power :s

I'll investigate a bit more tomorrow, if noone has a good idea.

data.title: Fix direct hit check in CreateEffectWarhead

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Closes #11184.

Originally, this was comparing distance beween `pos` and `unit.CenterPosition` with `HitShape`'s `OuterRadius`. However, the `OuterRadius` can exceed the shape for `Capsule` and `Rectangular` shapes, so I tried to adress that a few months ago by using the `DistanceFromEdge` check instead. The approach was bogus, though. `DistanceFromEdge` just calculates the distance of a position to the edge, so by comparing it with the distance between `pos` and `victim.CenterPosition` in combination with using `LengthSquared`, it was entirely possible the explosion would be within the `HitShape`, but closer to the edge than the `victim.CenterPosition` and the check would return `false`, despite the explosion happening inside the shape.

Now we simply check if `DistanceFromEdge` is `0` or negative.

data.title: [Idea] save the uptime of process "OpenRA.exe" also in Exception.log
data.body:
this would helpful to determine how difficult and if it is "easy" to reproduce the crashes and perhaps bugs :(

for example when we have a crash after a few Minutes / seconds: then it would be easy to reproduce... because it could be a crash what is happen very often or when a Crash is always after minutes or hours then it could be a crash which occurs not so often.

A lot of Games prints Uptime in Minutes also Windows in its Crashdumps

data.title: Using "restart (mission)" button does not re-randomize the "random/any" game settings
data.body:
Tested in skirmish, playtest 20160424

When a skirmish game has 
- factions and / or
- spawn points 
  set to random / any they don't get re-randomized when you restart the game.

I think it would be better - more fair if they get new values since the restart button is probably used when you fail and want to try again. 
Knowing the factions and spawn points of opponents in a bit of a cheat...

data.title: Unit cant occupy cell where crate is about to land.
data.body: Very annoying, pls fix.

data.title: Create low-level generic mission AI in LUA
data.body:
After discussion with @abcdefg30 I proposed creation of basic AI that will be supplies with missions if appropriate (base building/destroying missions).

One of posibilities to balance the original mission feeling and this is to create new "very hard" or rather "alternative" difficulty oriented on making missions more living at minor cost in authenticity. But it is alternative to pointless wiping out sitting duck AI we have currently.

This AI should be capable of:
- [ ] Base (re-)building
- [ ] Unit production
- [ ] Working eco (related to previous points)
- [ ] Harvester and refinery rebuilding and protection in case of common attacks/snipes.

I propose to use the buildup hack from Soviet 05 created by @abcdefg30 and supply maps with moderate reinforcements, linked to the eco. 

The missions might have to be altered as to keep them consistent with this AI and give them new "altered" dificulty strike teams/events etc. **Point of this is to make campaign challenging, create unorthodox situations and force player into quick response, while keeping the game MOSTLY fair** (you are playing against dumb AI trying to accomplish complicated tasks after all.

Please, feel free to add to discussion of this project and propose what else would you like to change, and how would you like to improve missions gameplay. And pls keep discussion civil :hamster:

data.title: Fix CreateEffectWarhead's GetDirectHit

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Currently, it sometimes doesn't consider impacts within a `HitShape` as direct hits (particularly in TS).

One problem might be that `GetDirectHit` only checks for actors on the impact cell, but the target's `HitShape` might very well have been touched on a cell adjacent to the cell housing the actor's `CenterPosition`, so we should extend this to a search radius similar to what `SpreadDamageWarhead` has.

Additionally,
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Warheads/CreateEffectWarhead.cs#L85
looks bogus to me. If I read that line correctly, when `DistanceFromEdge` is 0 (= inside `HitShape`), impact distance to target `CenterPosition` must be 0 as well to return `true`. But unless the projectile hits the target smack in the center, the target's `CenterPosition` will obviously be at least a bit further away than the `HitShape`, so this will almost never be true for slightly inaccurate weapons like missiles.

data.title: Fixed a NullReferenceException in OpenAL QueryDevices
data.body: According to https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/7b620dhe(v=vs.110).aspx Marshal.PtrToStringAnsi can return null so I assume this fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/11181.
